A patient with which of the following eye diseases would be at greatest risk for retinal damage from hypotension during surgery?

Anesthesia is induced in a 50-year-old, 125-kg man for laparoscopic cholecystectomy. The patient is placed on a ventilator. Peak airway pressure is noted to be 20 cm h2o with o2 saturation 99% on pulse oximeter. An hour later, the peak airway pressure rises to 40 cm h2o and paco2 is 38 mm hg on infrared spectrometer and on o2 Saturation falls to 88%. Blood pressure and heart rate are unchanged. The most likely cause of these findings is
Which statement concerning local anesthetics is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: The un-ionized form of a local anesthetic binds to the nerve membrane to block conduction

options.label: B
options.text: If one node of Ranvier is blocked, conduction will be reliably interrupted

options.label: C
options.text: The presence of myelin enhances the ability of a local anesthetic to block nerve conduction

options.label: D
options.text: Local anesthetics block transmission by inhibiting the voltage-gated potassium ion channels

questions.correct_answer: C. The presence of myelin enhances the ability of a local anesthetic to block nerve conduction

questions.text: Which one of the following statements about the fed and fasting metabolic states is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Fatty acids and triaclyglycerol are in the synthesized in the liver in the fasting state.

options.label: B
options.text: In the fasting state the main fuel for the central nervous system is fatty acids released from adipose tissue.

options.label: C
options.text: In the fasting state the main metabolic fuel for most tissue comes from fatty acids released from adipose tissue.

options.label: D
options.text: In the fed state muscle cannot take up glucose for use as a metabolic fuel because glucose transport in muscle is stimulated in response to glucagon.

questions.correct_answer: C. In the fasting state the main metabolic fuel for most tissue comes from fatty acids released from adipose tissue.

questions.text: A 54-year-old man with type 1 (IDDM) diabetes is referred to an ophthalmologist for evaluation of developing cataracts. Which of the following statements about purine nucleotide metabolism is NOT CORRECT?

options.label: A
options.text: An early step in Pyrimidine biosynthesis is the formation of PRPP (phosphoribosyl 1-pyrophosphate).

options.label: B
options.text: Inosine monophosphate (IMP) is a precursor of both AMP and GMP.

options.label: C
options.text: Orotic acid is an intermediate in pyrimidine nucleotide biosynthesis

options.label: D
options.text: Ribonucleotide reductase converts nucleoside diphosphates to the corresponding deoxyribo nucleoside diphosphates.

questions.correct_answer: A. An early step in Pyrimidine biosynthesis is the formation of PRPP (phosphoribosyl 1-pyrophosphate).

questions.text: Supraglottoplasty is the treatment of choice for severe cases of:

questions.text: Which of the following statements are correct? i. Griesinger sign refers to erythema and edema behind the mastoid process resulting from septic thrombi of the mastoid emissary veins in lateral sinus thrombosis. ii. Delta sign refers to the appearance of a lateral sinus thrombosis on contrast-enhanced radiographic imaging resulting from the nonenhancing clot surrounded by enhancing dural sinus wall. iii. The halo sign, a clinically detectable single ring sign. iv. Brown sign refers to blanching of the tympanic membrane when applying positive pressure and can be seen in glomus jugulare tumors. v. Bezold sign refers to bruising behind the ear at the mastoid process and is seen in fractures of the petrous temporal bone.

A 70 year old male presents with a 3 month history of right pulsatile tinnitus with hearing loss, unstable gait,and autophany.ECOG demonstrates a SP/AP ratio of 0.6. A diagnosis of superior semicircular cancal dehiscence is suspected. Which of the following is a good indicator test that would give support to this diagnosis:
questions.correct_answer: C. Cervical vestibular evoked myogenic potential

questions.text: Tonsillitis associated with a gray membrane covering the surface of the tonsil but that may be removed without bleeding is often associated with which of the following?

questions.correct_answer: C. In pediatric tracheostomy, a circular ring of anterior tracheal wall is removed

questions.text: Asymmetrical Congestive Response (The Nasal Cycle) occurs every:-
After a temporal bone trauma, where is the most common injury site to the ossicular chain?

options.label: A
options.text: Incudostapedial joint > dislocation of the incus > fracture of the stapes crura > fixation of the ossicles in the epitympanum > fracture of the malleus

options.label: B
options.text: Dislocation of the incus > incudostapedial joint > fracture of the stapes crura > fixation of the ossicles in the epitympanum > fracture of the malleus

options.label: C
options.text: Fracture of the stapes crura > incudostapedial joint > dislocation of the incus > fixation of the ossicles in the epitympanum > fracture of the malleus

options.label: D
options.text: Incudostapedial joint > fracture of the malleus> dislocation of the incus > fracture of the stapes crura > fixation of the ossicles in the epitympanum

questions.correct_answer: A. Incudostapedial joint > dislocation of the incus > fracture of the stapes crura > fixation of the ossicles in the epitympanum > fracture of the malleus

questions.text: A patient from West Bengal presents to casualty with pigmentation changes of skin, hard patches on palms and soles, basal cell carcinoma of skin. What could be the possible cause?
Which is not a correct match

options.text: Hydrogen sulphide – rotten egg like smell

questions.correct_answer: C. Zinc phosphide – garlic like smell

questions.text: A 2-days old neonate born to a 24-year-old mother without adequate prenatal care is admitted in NICU with bulging fontanelle and intense crying. On physical examination, The neonate is hypothermic, tachycardic, and tachypneic, and has mottled skin. Blood samples are obtained, and empiric antibiotics are initiated for the treatment of sepsis. Culture on blood agar grows bacterial colonies with a narrow zone of clear hemolysis. A special test shown in the image is revealed the pathogen. Which of the following is the most likely pathogen infecting this neonate?

A 32 year patient spontaneously delivers a stillborn fetus with multiple congenital malformations. Fetal autopsy reveals microcephaly with thin cerebral cortices, ventriculomegaly, and subcortical calcifications. Viral RNA of a neurotropic virus is detected in body fluids of the mother and the fetus. Transplacental transmission of this virus causes apoptosis of neural progenitor cells in the developing fetus, leading to disruption of neuronal proliferation, migration, and differentiation. Name the vector responsible for transmitting this viral disease?

Few cases of severe pharyngitis were reported in a community of immigrants. The patients had thick pharyngeal exudates, neck swelling, and difficulty swallowing. One of them died from severe heart failure. The toxin responsible has a mechanism of action most similar to another toxin produced by which of the following bacteria?

A 30-year-old woman comes to the emergency department with leg swelling. Her dog, which is fully vaccinated and has lived with her for the past year, bite her on the left leg last night, leading to a break in the skin and bleeding. The patient irrigated the wound with bottled water and soap and managed her pain with paracetamol. This morning, the wound area became warm, red, and swollen. On examination, temperature is 36.40 C. There is an open wound on the left leg, with surrounding erythema, warmth, and tenderness. No wound drainage or crepitus is present. The distal pulses are palpable. Wound cultures grow gram-negative coccobacilli; the culture has a mouse-like odor. Which of the following organisms is most likely responsible for this patient's current presentation?

A neonate born to a 26-year-old woman is evaluated in the new-born nursery. The patient was delivered vaginally at 38 weeks gestation, and Apgar scores were 8 and 9 at 1 and 5 minutes, respectively. Initial evaluation shows hydrocephalus, jaundice, and hepatosplenomegaly. Funduscopic examination reveals retinal exudates and scarring. Histopathologic evaluation of the placenta shows infiltration of lymphocytes, plasma cells, and macrophages, as well as many areas of calcification. Within the placental tissue, there are numerous intracellular, crescent-shaped organisms with a central nucleus as shown in the image. Which of the following is the infective stage for the pathogen responsible for this condition?

A 21-year-old man is brought to the emergency department in a stuporous condition. He returned from a visit to rural village 2 weeks ago. One week ago, the patient began developing high-grade fever, headaches, severe myalgias, and joint pains. He had similar symptoms following a trip to the same village 4 years ago, but at that time the symptoms did not progress and instead resolved spontaneously within a few days. Temperature is 38.30 C, blood pressure is 80/50 mm Hg, and pulse is 128/min. Examination shows a diffuse maculopapular rash, multiple purpuric lesions, and hepatomegaly. Laboratory studies shows marked thrombocytopenia, leukopenia, and elevated liver aminotransferases. Which of the following is the most likely mechanism for this patient's current severe illness?

options.label: C
options.text: Infection with a different viral serotype

questions.correct_answer: C. Infection with a different viral serotype

questions.text: A 3-year-old boy is being evaluated for persistent diarrhea. Although the patient seemed healthy at his 12- month well child visit, since then he has experienced 4 episodes of otitis media and 3 episodes of pneumococcal pneumonia. He was at the 50th percentile for weight and height at 12 months but is now at the 25th percentile for height and 10th percentile for weight. The patient is referred for upper gastrointestinal endoscopy, and Giardia lamblia is demonstrated from duodenal aspirates. Further workup shows very low serum levels of all immunoglobulin types. Flow cytometry of this patient's peripheral blood is most likely to show a near absence of cells bearing which of the following markers?

A 42-year-old man comes to the physician because of dysuria and blood in his urine at the end of urination. He returned to the India 2 weeks ago after several months touring Africa. While there. he went spelunking, bathed in the beaches and lakes. and ate the local street food. Physical examination is unremarkable. Ultrasonography reveals mild bilateral hydronephrosis and bladder wall thickening. Urine microscopy revealed the pathogen as shown in the image. Which of the following animals is the most likely source of this patient's infection?

A 18-year-old boy is returned from US hospitalized with recent-onset insomnia, headaches. periodic agitation, and dysphagia. He is a high school student interested in becoming a veterinarian. He owns a snake, fish and parrot and about 4 weeks ago, went on a field trip to study bats in a cave. The patient has no known medical problems and is not taking any medications. He does not consume alcohol and has never used illicit drugs. Despite hospitalization and treatment, he develops painful spasms, progressive paralysis, coma and dies. Which of the following interventions would have most likely prevented this student from developing this illness?

A 21-year-old previously healthy man comes to the clinic due to fever. Malaise, myalgia, and non-productive cough. His symptoms began 2 weeks after returning from exploring caves in Tamil Nadu. The patient does not use tobacco, alcohol, or illicit drugs. Temperature is 38.30 C. blood pressure is 120/70 mm Hg, pulse is 96/min, and respirations are 15/min. Physical examination reveals lung crackles. Chest x-ray shows patchy parenchymal infiltrates with enlarged mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes. Which of the following is most likely to be present in this patient‘s pulmonary lesions?

options.label: A
options.text: Budding yeasts with a thick capsule

questions.correct_answer: B. Macrophages with intracellular small yeasts

Most common cause of pleural effusion is

A 24-year-old Primigravida was admitted with fever with chills and right hypochondriac pain. Hemogram revealed WBC count of 25600 with a normal platelet count. Her LFT and RFT were normal. USG revealed the presence of multiple hepatic abscesses. She was started on IV antibiotics. She developed sudden onset palpitations and her Pulse was rapid and irregular. BP was 96/64 mm of Hg and she appeared restless. She was transferred to the ICU and ECG was recorded.

A 20-year-old male presented to the clinic with history of fever with chills for past 2 days. He complained of associated headache and myalgia. The highest recorded temperature at home was 41? C and there was no particular pattern. Patient is case of Hereditary Spherocytosis and underwent Splenectomy for the same at 12 years of age since he was transfusion dependant. His vaccination history is complete. On examination he had a Temperature of 40? C, P-90/min, BP-100/60mm of Hg. He had pallor and icterus with no lymphadenopathy. Laboratory tests revealed a Hb-7.3gm/dl, WBC-4600, Plt-94000. His Liver function test showed an elevated bilirubin with elevated ALP, SGOT, SGPT. Urine analysis showed haemoglobinuria and proteinuria. Examination of Giemsa-stained thin smear revealed ameboid trophozoites lacking hemozoin deposits. What is the diagnosis?

A 70-year-old female presents with complaints of severe unilateral headache which is worse on supine position. She also reports myalgia, low grade fever and weight loss of 8 kgs in the last 6 months. There is history of Jaw claudication with intermittent diplopia. Following statements about her condition are true EXCEPT

options.label: A
options.text: She is most probably suffering from a Granulomatous vasculitis.

options.label: B
options.text: Biopsy is likely to reveal oedematous infiltration of the intima, media and adventitia with lymphocytes and macrophages with giant cells.

options.label: C
options.text: The EULAR recommendations allow Doppler study as an alternative to Biopsy in such cases

options.label: D
options.text: The dreaded complication in such cases is blindness which is most commonly due to Anterior ciliary artery involvement leading to A.I.O.N.

questions.correct_answer: D. The dreaded complication in such cases is blindness which is most commonly due to Anterior ciliary artery involvement leading to A.I.O.N.

questions.text: 34-year-old female presented with frequent headaches and bodyache since the past 4-5 months. She appears stressed and accepts that there is work pressure on her to meet deadlines. She also complains of inability to focus on her work. She has disturbed sleep and wakes up tired on majority of the days. Which antibody is most likely associated with her condition?

76 years gentleman came to the clinic for a routine follow-up. He is an obese patient with history of hypertension for 20 years. His BP is controlled on Telmisartan + Hydrochlorthiazide combination. He is non diabetic and takes Atorvastatin for his dyslipidemia. He complains of occasional palpitations and feels tired. He lost his wife a month ago and acknowledged feeling low. ECG was recorded. What is the diagnosis and its probable cause in this case?

options.label: B
options.text: Right bundle branch block – Degenerative HD

options.label: C
options.text: Left bundle branch block – Ischemic heart disease

options.label: D
options.text: Left ventricular hypertrophy – hypertensive heart disease

questions.correct_answer: B. Right bundle branch block – Degenerative HD

An expectant mother is seen for a prenatal visit. Prenatal genetic testing performed on her fetus showed karyotype 45,X. She will be meeting with a genetic counselor in the coming days. Of the following, the MOST likely cardiac disorder to be seen in this fetus is

A 6-month-old male infant who is limp and exhibiting obtundation in the morning is brought to the emergency department. Bedside blood analysis reveals a significant metabolic acidosis, including an elevated lactate level and a capillary blood glucose level of 35 mg/dL (1.9 mmol/L) and 3+ ketones in the urine. His newborn screening results were normal. His parents report that he only recently has been able to sleep through the night without waking for a feeding and that he has had a few episodes of morning lethargy that improved after his first morning feeding. The infant appears small and nearly comatose. He has chubby cheeks, a short nose, and a relatively small chin. He has a temperature of 37.8°C, a heart rate of 155 beats/min, a respiratory rate of 15 breaths/min, and a blood pressure of 75/45 mm Hg. Cardiac examination reveals no murmur and a normal S1 and S2. The liver edge is palpable 3 cm below the right costal margin. The remainder of the physical examination findings are unremarkable. Of the following, the MOST likely diagnosis is

A female neonate born at term is evaluated in the neonatal intensive care unit. The pregnancy was complicated by maternal gestational diabetes and alcohol exposure. Prenatal ultrasonography at 20 weeks showed intrauterine growth retardation. The neonate is presently intubated. Her birth weight is 2,200 g. She has a small jaw, clenched hands with overlapping fingers, rocker-bottom feet, a short sternum, and hypoplastic nails. Echocardiography shows a ventricular septal defect. Renal ultrasonography shows a horseshoe kidney. Of the following, the MOST likely diagnosis is

A pediatrician receives a phone call from the state’s newborn screening program regarding a 7-day-old neonate with an elevated trypsinogen, which is concerning for a diagnosis of cystic fibrosis. The neonate was seen by the pediatrician’s partner 1 day ago and had appropriate feeding and growth parameters as well as normal vital signs and physical examination findings. The partner noted that there is no significant family history of diseases in childhood. Of the following, the MOST appropriate next step is to

options.label: A
options.text: Inform the parents of the diagnosis of cystic fibrosis

options.label: B
options.text: Discuss the result at the 2-month health supervision visit

options.label: C
options.text: Reassure the parents that this is likely a false-positive result

options.label: D
options.text: Schedule the neonate for diagnostic testing

questions.correct_answer: D. Schedule the neonate for diagnostic testing

A 45-year HIV patient presents with fever and night sweats. Examination shows generalised lymphadenopathy and splenomegaly. Biopsy from one of the lymphnode shows hyalinisation of follicle and onion skinning as shown in the image. Likely diagnosis?

A 53-year old presents with epistaxis. Biopsy from the mass shows a tumor with small round cells centered around the blood vessel. Immunohistochemistry shows the neoplastic cells are CD45 (LCA)+, CD3-, CD4- CD20-, CD16+, EBV+. Which of the following is most likely diagnosis?
True about TRALI are all except

options.label: C
options.text: Occurs due to anti HLA antibodies in the patient

questions.correct_answer: C. Occurs due to anti HLA antibodies in the patient

questions.text: A 6-year boy presents with multiple petechial patches and purpura after respiratory tract infection. Platelet count is 40000. Which of the following is true regarding this case
questions.correct_answer: C. BM will show increased megakaryocytes

questions.text: A 25-year old female presents with cough and hemoptysis, biopsy from the lung shows casseating granuloma. A TB PCR was positive. Flow cytometric analysis of T cells isolated from lesion show T helper cells. Which of the following is correctly matched regarding these helper cells?
All the following cause painful ulcers except:
An 8 year old child presents with localized alopecia over scalp with scales. The diagnosis is:

A 20-year-old patient comes with widespread itchy oozing plaques on the body including on the back of the knee. He also has a history of recurrent such lesions. Which drug would not be helpful in this patient.
A patient presents with itchy lesions on trunk as shown. Subsequently, new lesions are seen on the trunk along the ribs. Pick the true statement:

options.label: A
options.text: Topical antifungals need to be given

questions.text: Koebner’s phenomenon is not seen in
Which of the following investigation does not match with the diagnosis of iron deficiency anemia in pregnancy?

A 26 years old lady presented with acute onset of breathlessness and fatigue for 5-7 days. She had a full-term normal delivery 1 month back. She had mild pre-eclampsia during antenatal period but her BP was normal after delivery. Her Hb is 11.2gm%. There is no history of any cardio respiratory disease in past. Her chest X ray is normal. Her 2D echo shows LVEF of 35% with no cardiac lesion. Her ECG is within normal limits. Which of the following is the most likely cause?

A 32 years old G3A2 has 32 weeks of gestation has had convulsion of generalised tonic clonic type. She has been brought in emergency room with post-ictal drowsiness and BP of 160/110mm Hg. Which of the following is true regarding this case?

options.label: A
options.text: MgSO4 acts as anti-convulsant of choice and it also has anti-hypertensive property

options.label: B
options.text: If convulsion does not recur then pregnancy can be continued with MgSO4 cover.

options.label: C
options.text: Alpha methyldopa is drug of choice for hypertension

options.label: D
options.text: Ergometrine should be avoided since it is a vasoconstrictor

questions.correct_answer: D. Ergometrine should be avoided since it is a vasoconstrictor

questions.text: Which of the following is incorrect regarding thyroid disorder in pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: Most common cause of thyrotoxicosis is Grave’s disease

options.label: B
options.text: Most common cause of hypothyroidism is iodine deficiency

options.label: C
options.text: Propylthiouracil is the drug of choice in first trimester for hyperthyroidism

options.label: D
options.text: Methimazole can be given from second trimester for hyperthyroidism

questions.correct_answer: B. Most common cause of hypothyroidism is iodine deficiency

questions.text: Primigravida with 22 weeks of gestation with Hb 7 gm%, not able to tolerate oral iron therapy is subjected to parenteral iron therapy (iron sucrose). Her weight is 50 kg. Calculate the amount of iron to be given to this patient:
Which one of the following is not a WHO category IV heart disease patient?

Primigravida with 24 weeks of gestation has come for the first time for ante natal visit. Her DIPSI test was 168mg%, HbA1c was 7.8%. Usg Obs was within normal limits. TIFFA scan was within normal limits. Which of the following is not true?

options.label: A
options.text: The drug of choice is insulin therapy

options.label: B
options.text: She is a case of pre gestational DM

options.label: C
options.text: Ideal blood sugar levels are F <95, 1hr<140, 2hr<120mg%

options.label: D
options.text: IUGR cannot occur in this case

questions.correct_answer: D. IUGR cannot occur in this case

questions.text: Which one of the following patients is not suitable for metformin therapy?

options.label: D
options.text: PCOS with raised fasting insulin levels

questions.text: One of the following is not a bad prognostic marker in Gestational Trophoblastic neoplasia?

A 23 years old G2P1L1 with 13 weeks of gestation has a history of passage of grape like vesicles for 1 day. On examination there is snow-storm appearance of products of conception. She is subjected to suction and evacuation. Her baseline b-HCG is 85000IU/L. Which of the following is correct regarding the further management?

options.label: A
options.text: She should be subjected to weekly b-HCG till it is undetectable and then monthly b-HCG for 12 months, COC pills for contraception.

options.label: B
options.text: She should be subjected to weekly b-HCG till it is undetectable and then monthly b-HCG for 6 months, Cu-T for contraception

options.label: C
options.text: She should be subjected to weekly b-HCG till it is undetectable and then monthly b-HCG for 6 months, COC pills for contraception

options.label: D
options.text: Weekly b-HCG till it is undetectable. Once it is negative, she is allowed to conceive if she desires.

questions.correct_answer: C. She should be subjected to weekly b-HCG till it is undetectable and then monthly b-HCG for 6 months, COC pills for contraception

questions.text: A 32 years old nulliparous patient had history of 3 abortions in last 3 years. All her abortions were spontaneous and were of 8-9 weeks. What is the possible cause amongst the following?

options.label: C
options.text: Balanced translocation in patient and partner

questions.correct_answer: C. Balanced translocation in patient and partner

questions.text: A 25 years old primigravida with tubal ectopic pregnancy of 6 weeks was subjected to single dose therapy (medical management). Her b-HCG value is 2500 IU/L on day 4 of treatment. After three days of methotrexate injection, her b-HCG is 3250 IU/L. What is the next best line of management?

options.label: B
options.text: Repeat the b-HCG test after 3 days

questions.text: According to Gainsville’s classification, if there is acute salpingitis with peritonitis then it is considered as?
All are true regarding bacterial vaginosis except?

options.label: B
options.text: Patient complains of vaginal discharge with itching

options.label: C
options.text: It is not a sexually transmitted infection

options.label: D
options.text: It is more common in patients with presence of sexually transmitted infection

questions.correct_answer: B. Patient complains of vaginal discharge with itching

questions.text: A 32 years old sexually active nulliparous patient has come with history of burning micturition with vaginal discharge since last 7 days. On examination, there are white flakes seen on vaginal epithelium. On removal of those flakes, there is severe inflammation seen in vagina. Her partner is not having any such symptom. What would be most likely found on wet mount examination?

options.label: A
options.text: Vaginal epithelial cells with irregular margins

options.label: D
options.text: Vaginal epithelial cells with inclusion bodies

questions.correct_answer: B. Spores and rods forming pseudo-hyphae

questions.text: One of the following is included in specific criteria for diagnosis of PID as per CDC guideline?

options.label: A
options.text: C. Trachomatis or N.Gonorrhoea NAAT positive

questions.correct_answer: B. Endometrial biopsy suggestive of endometritis

questions.text: One of the following is not correct regarding boundaries of ovarian fossa:

options.label: B
options.text: Anteriorly and inferiorly by broad ligament

options.label: C
options.text: Posteriorly by internal iliac vessels and ureter

options.label: D
options.text: Inferiorly by obturator vessels and nerve

questions.correct_answer: A. Superiorly by psoas major muscle

questions.text: Which of the following is not true regarding NEXPLANON contraceptive?

options.label: C
options.text: It is safe in DVT since it is progesteronic

options.label: D
options.text: It must be removed after 3 years

questions.correct_answer: C. It is safe in DVT since it is progesteronic

questions.text: Which of the following is not true regarding this contraceptive?

options.label: B
options.text: Progesterone inhibits ovulation by inhibiting LH surge

options.label: C
options.text: Also used in treatment of endometrial hyperplasia without atypia

options.label: D
options.text: Safe in patients with estrogenic side effects

questions.correct_answer: B. Progesterone inhibits ovulation by inhibiting LH surge

questions.text: According to MTP act (amendment 2020, passed in 2021 which came into effect from 24th September 2021), MTP for pregnancy due to rape is allowed till?

options.label: B
options.text: 24 weeks and 2 doctors are needed for 20-24 week MTP

questions.correct_answer: B. 24 weeks and 2 doctors are needed for 20-24 week MTP

questions.text: Identify the following instrument:
Which tumour markers constitute “roma score” for ovarian malignancy?
questions.correct_answer: B. ca-125 and human epididymis protein 4

In a 25 years old nulliparous patient with amenorrhoea, the test which can differentiate ovarian failure from endometrial failure is?
Which Le fort fracture causes Cranio-facial disjonction?
Which of the following breast implant is associated with higher risk of Anaplastic Large cell lymphoma?
According to Jackson burn model, Non salvageable zone in burn is?
Identify the instrument used for facial bone fixation?
In laparoscopic hernia surgery, corona mortis refers to?

options.label: A
options.text: An Ectopic gonadal vessel found in triangle of doom

options.label: B
options.text: An aberrant artery between obturator and the external iliac or inferior epigastric arteries

questions.correct_answer: B. An aberrant artery between obturator and the external iliac or inferior epigastric arteries

questions.text: Diversion colitis seen after end colostomy is due to deficiency of?

A 48-year-old woman develops pain in the right lower quadrant while playing tennis. The pain progresses and the patient presents to the emergency room later that day with a low-grade fever, Hg 11 gm% and WBC count of 10,000/mm3 and complaints of anorexia and nausea as well as persistent, sharp pain in lower abdomen (more on right side). On examination, she is tender in the right lower quadrant with muscular spasm, and Carnett’s sign and Fothergill’s sign were positive. An ultrasound is ordered and shows an apparent mass in the abdominal wall. This condition is associated with all except?
Which of the following is not a surgery for Pilonidal sinus?
Which of the following is not a radiological sign of Sigmoid volvulus
Piggyback technique is used for?
Which of the following type of abscess can become horse-shoe abscess?
Established recommended treatment for Pseudomyxoma peritonei is?
Which of the following is not recommended in enhanced recovery programme for colorectal cancer surgery

options.label: A
options.text: Thorough and extensive mechanical bowel preparation

questions.correct_answer: A. Thorough and extensive mechanical bowel preparation

questions.text: Best investigation to detect prostate secondaries is?
Which of the following is not an advantage of Meshing of split thickness graft

options.label: B
options.text: Helps in egress of collection from below the graft

questions.text: Most common site of obstruction in Hydrocephalus is?
If TURP is extended below Veru Montanum, there is higher risk of?
A patient presented with a thyroid nodule with euthyroid status. FNAC reported Bathesda score 5. What is the ideal advise for this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Repeat FNAC as it is inconclusive

questions.text: False statement about parathyroid is?

options.label: A
options.text: Superior parathyroid is deeper to RLN while inferior is superficial to RLN

options.label: B
options.text: PTH increases calcium absorption from Kidney so hyperparathyroidism is characterized by decreased urinary calcium

options.label: C
options.text: Most common cause of Primary hyperparathyroidism is solitary adenoma

options.label: D
options.text: In De George syndrome there is absence of parathyroid and Thymus.

questions.correct_answer: B. PTH increases calcium absorption from Kidney so hyperparathyroidism is characterized by decreased urinary calcium

questions.text: Which of the following finding has been removed from 10th addition of ATLS guidelines as suggestive sign of pelvic fracture (Although it was included in 9th edition).

options.label: A
options.text: High riding prostate in PR examination

options.label: B
options.text: Scrotal haematoma and blood at urethral meatus

options.label: D
options.text: Rotational deformity of leg without obvious fracture

questions.correct_answer: A. High riding prostate in PR examination

questions.text: False statement about Diaphragmatic injury is?

options.label: A
options.text: Left side is more common than right

options.label: C
options.text: Delayed presentation in common (due to herniation)

options.label: D
options.text: Repair is best done from thoracotomy

questions.correct_answer: D. Repair is best done from thoracotomy

questions.text: Which type of dressing has highest absorptive capacity?
Flow rate through a pink IV cannula is?
Small bowel obstruction after Roux en Y Gastric bypasss should be treated as an urgent surgical emergency because?

options.label: A
options.text: It is frequently due to an incarcerated internal hernia which can progress to bowel necrosis and perforation

options.label: B
options.text: Abdominal distension risks disruption of suture lines

options.label: C
options.text: Signs and symptoms of peritonitis, such as pain, fever, and leukocytosis, are usually masked in the obese

options.label: D
options.text: Nasogastric intubation will not decompress the distal gastric remnant

questions.correct_answer: A. It is frequently due to an incarcerated internal hernia which can progress to bowel necrosis and perforation

questions.text: Sequence of anastomosis in hand reimplantation is?

options.label: A
options.text: Bone fixation > Nerve repair > artery repair > Venous anastomoses > flexor tendon > extensor tendon repair > skin +/- fasciotomy

options.label: B
options.text: Bone fixation > extensor tendon repair > Flexor tendon repair > Nerve repair > Venous anastomoses > skin +/- fasciotomy

options.label: C
options.text: Bone fixation > Flexor tendon > Nerve > artery repair > Venous anastomoses > Extensor repair > skin +/- fasciotomy

options.label: D
options.text: Bone fixation > extensor tendon repair > artery repair > Venous anastomoses > flexor tendon > nerve repair > skin +/- fasciotomy

questions.correct_answer: D. Bone fixation > extensor tendon repair > artery repair > Venous anastomoses > flexor tendon > nerve repair > skin +/- fasciotomy

questions.text: A 32 year old man is presented with the following clinical presentation What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 9 year old child is brought by his parents with chief complains of pain and swelling in right thigh which have exaggerated since last couple of weeks. His Thorough examination was done earlier which revealed Increased TLC, Neutrophils and ESR. His repeated blood cultures went Negative. X Ray Was done which showed lesion in femur mainly in diaphysis with some laminated periosteal reaction. What is the NEXT investigation that should be done?

A 42 year old female presents with tingling and numbness in right hand that awakens her in the middle of the night for last two weeks. She also gives history of being treated for diabetes and hypothyroidism for last 3 years by an endocrinologist. Which of the following ain't true about this condition from the following options?

options.label: A
options.text: Splintage is helpful only in few initial months of onset of symptoms

options.label: B
options.text: Motor Symptoms appear early in the course of the disease

options.label: C
options.text: Durakn's Test is the most specific clinical test in the diagnosis

options.label: D
options.text: It is the most common focal compression neuropathy

questions.correct_answer: B. Motor Symptoms appear early in the course of the disease

questions.text: An 8 year old boy presents with Right Hip Pain and Limping Gait for last one week. The mothers gives history of recent URTI in last month only. The examination revealed limitation of hip movements only in extremes. Blood counts are almost normal except Raised ESR. What is the diagnosis?
Identify the test being performed in this image
